intro: Pedicularis longiflora var. yinshanensis, commonly known as the Yinshan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant pink to purple flowers, which are often clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
